data.name: Approximate
entries: {@note Adapted from Pathfinder by Landon}

Your magic quickly flows over an area to help you count and catalog. Name a particular type of object you are looking for within the area. You gain an instant estimate of the quantity of the chosen objects that are clearly visible within the target area. The number is rounded to the largest digit. For example, you could look at a pile of 180 copper coins, and you would learn that it held about 200 coins, but you couldn't determine there were exactly 180 coins.

The type of object you name can be as specific or general as you like—“dented copper coins” is as viable as “coins”—but the distinguishing features must be obvious at a glance, and the spell is automatically fooled by objects disguised as other objects. For instance, the spell would register copper coins plated in gold as gold coins, not copper coins.

data.name: Caustic Blade
entries: {@note Made by Ellie}

You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and then becomes coated in acid. At the beginning of your next turn, the spell ends and the target takes {@dice 1d4} Acid damage unless it used an action to remove the acid.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The attack and the acid deal extra Acid damage when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 1d8} and {@dice 2d4}), 11 ({@dice 2d8} and {@dice 3d4}), and 17 ({@dice 3d8} and {@dice 4d4}).

data.name: Frostbitten Blade
entries: {@note Made by Ellie}

You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and then becomes wreathed in frost until the start of your next turn. If another creature than you hits the target with an attack before then, it takes an additional {@dice 1d6} Cold damage, and the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The attack and the frost deal extra Cold damage when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 1d8} and {@dice 2d6}), 11 ({@dice 2d8} and {@dice 3d6}), and 17 ({@dice 3d8} and {@dice 4d6}).

data.name: Overcharged Blade
entries: {@note Made by Ellie}

You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and then becomes haloed with electricity until the start of your next turn. If the target misses an attack roll before then, it takes {@dice 1d6} Lightning damage and the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The attack and the electricity deal extra Lightning damage when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 1d8} and {@dice 2d4}), 11 ({@dice 2d8} and {@dice 3d6}), and 17 ({@dice 3d8} and {@dice 4d6}).

data.name: Vile Dagger
entries: {@note Made by Aris}
A shard of evil appears within your hand. You are Proficient with this {@item dagger|XPHB}, and no other creature is Proficient with it.
All damage dealt by the {@item dagger|XPHB} is vile damage.
(vile damage is just like other damage but that is very difficult to heal)

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: When you reach 5th level, you gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls made with the {@item dagger|XPHB}. This bonus increases to +2 at 11th level, and +3 at 17th level.

data.name: Aberrate
entries: {@note Repassing from WM3, from 3.5e. Made by Chrys.}

You transform one willing creature into an Aberration. Its flesh twists and warps into thick, mutated hide. The target's creature type changes to Aberration and it gains a +1 bonus to AC while not wearing armor for the duration of the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the AC bonus increases by 1 for each slot level above 1st.

data.name: Allergy Field
entries: {@note Adapted from 2e, Repassed from WM3, Made by Chrys.}
You target a patch of plant life within range, causing the plants to produce pollen, antigens, or similar allergens.

The plants release these allergens in a 5-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere}. When a creature enters the spell’s area for the first time or starts its turn there, that creature must make a Constitution saving throw. Creatures that don’t need to breathe or have Immune to Poison damage or the {@condition Poisoned} condition automatically succeed on this saving throw.

On a failed save, the creature takes {@dice 2d4} Poison damage and is {@condition Poisoned} for 1 minute. A {@condition Poisoned} creature repeats saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on a success.
Creatures that succeed on the saving throw are immune to the effects of the allergens for the duration of the spell.
The field of allergens lasts for the duration or until a strong wind (such as one created by {@spell Gust of Wind|XPHB}) disperses it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The field's radius increases by 5 feet for each spell slot level above 1.

data.name: Book Sense
entries: {@note Made by Gem}

When you cast this spell you can name a topic. For the duration, you can see a faint aura on any books, tomes, or other objects that contain writing related to the topic within 60 feet of yourself. If it is written in a language you do not understand or is concealed by magic, you are unable to sense it.

Additionally you can take the {@action Magic|XPHB} action to touch a book, tome, or other object containing writing. If it is in a language you understand and not concealed by magic, you learn a brief summary of what the writing is about.

data.name: Complex Idea
entries: {@note Made by Gem}

You attempt to send a complex thought into the mind of a creature. The target makes an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@dice 3d6} Psychic damage and has Disadvantage on Intelligence checks until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 1.

data.name: Cryptmaster's Call
entries: {@note Made by Patrick}
Convening with The Cryptmaster, played by the GM, the caster may write a single word, and The Cryptmaster creates a magical effect based on the word, or rejects the request completely.
Whatever word the caster writes must be able to replicate the effects of a cantrip or 1st-level spell, or have an equivalently powerful impact.
Examples of words to use include:
CRABS - Summon two CR 0 Crab monsters as an ally (Duration 10 mins, {@status Concentration|XPHB}).
BLOCK - Adds a +2 Magic Bonus to your Armor Class until the start of your next turn.
ZAP - Make a ranged spell attack against a target within 60 ft. The target takes {@damage 2d8} Lightning damage.
TRIP - Force a target within 30 ft. to make a strength saving throw. On a fail, the target becomes {@condition prone}.
LOOK - The Cryptmaster describes an object or location around you that you are unable to perceive via sight.

If you cast the spell more than once before finishing a Long Rest or make a request that displeases the Cryptmaster, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you become unable to cast this spell again until the next dawn (The GM might also deny further castings at their will).

data.name: Detect Pronouns
entries: {@note Made by Chrys}
For the duration, you know the preferred pronouns of all creatures and objects within 30 feet of you.
The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

data.name: Insect
entries: {@note Made by Gem}

You summon an insect. A bug even. It manifests in an unoccupied space you can see within range and uses the {@creature Spider|XMM} stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 Hit Points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, the creature shares your Initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and uses its movement to avoid danger.

data.name: Placebo
entries: {@note Made by Aris}
A creature you touch gains a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 2d8} plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

This spell only affects creatures that are missing {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, and the number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} cannot exceed the number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} the creature is missing. The creature loses these {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} when it regains any of its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.
The creature believes that it regained {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} via the {@spell Cure Wounds|XPHB} spell, instead of gaining {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

The target can take a {@action Search|XPHB} action to examine their own status with a Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check against your spell save DC. If the check succeeds, the target realizes that the healing was fake, and it loses its {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} increase by {@dice 2d8} for each spell slot level above 1.

data.name: Preserve Work
entries: {@note Made by Gem}

When you cast this spell, you touch a nonmagical book, tome, artwork, or other physical work. The work becomes protected from damage and wear. The work is unable to be damaged by nonmagical means. Whenever the work is damaged by magical means, it reforms the damaged section to its exact form when the spell was cast over the course of 10 minutes.
If the work is fully destroyed before it has time to reform, the spell ends and the work is destroyed.

components.m: A piece of fresh parchment, a bottle of ink, a lead weight, and a block of clear wax

data.name: Puppet
entries: {@note From 5e UA. Made by Chrys.}

Your gesture forces one Humanoid you can see within range to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target must move up to its Speed in a direction you choose. In addition, you can cause the target to drop anything it is holding. This spell has no effect on Humanoids that have Immunity to the {@condition Charmed} condition.

data.name: Random Action
entries: {@note Adapted from 3e, Made by Chrys.}

You attempt to taint a creature you can see within range with delusion. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition Confused|WM4} until the end of its next turn. A target with an Intelligence score less than 4 automatically succeeds on the save.

data.name: Rotting Ward
entries: {@note Made by Lily}
You shroud yourself in deathly energy to protect yourself from enemies. If a creature hits you with a melee attack, it must make a Constitution save. On a fail, it takes {@dice 1d6} Necrotic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, attackers take {@dice 1d6} more damage for every two slot levels above 1st.

data.name: Scholar's Touch

components.m: a scrap of parchment, a pinch of tinder, and a thin crystal disk worth at least 50 gp

entries: {@note From 3.5e, Ported by Aris}

You touch a book or scroll and absorb the knowledge contained within as if you had just read it. This is equivalent to a solid reading but not deep study—you do not gain perfect recall of the information, only whatever you would have gotten from reading it completely once.
If you can't read the language of the source, the spell has no effect. This spell cannot be used to prepare spells or to cast magical scrolls, nor does it have any effect when reading a magical book

data.name: Shield Emotions

time.condition: which you take immediately before a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself makes an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw

entries: {@note Made by Vivek}
You grant the triggering creature an ounce of mental fortitude. Until the start of its next turn, the triggering creature gains {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on that type of saving throw.

data.name: Shred Arcane
entries: {@note Made by Gem.}

You shred a page of your spellbook, spraying it in a 30-foot cone. When you cast this spell, pick a spell you have prepared from your spellbook of 1st-level. The spell is immediately unprepared and removed from your spellbook. If the chosen spell cannot be unprepared or removed, the spell fails. If you don't have any spells you can pick, this spell fails without expending the slot.
Each creature of your choice in the cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it takes {@dice 4d6} Slashing damage. On a success, it takes half as much damage.

If for any reason this spell fails to take effect, you do not unprepare nor remove the chosen spell from your spellbook. If a creature attempts to cast {@spell Counterspell|XPHB} in reaction to the casting of this spell, you automatically succeed on the saving throw against it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Your chosen spell must be of the same level of the slot used. The damage increases by {@dice 3d6} for each spell slot level above 1.

data.name: Shush
entries: {@note Made by Gem}
One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it has the {@condition Silenced|WM4} condition.

A {@condition Silenced|WM4} target makes another Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a success the spell ends. If the creature fails against this spell three times, it stops making saving throws to break free, being {@condition Silenced|WM4} until the spell ends normally.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Your {@status Concentration|XPHB} can last longer with a spell slot of level 3+ (1 hour) or 5+ (8 hours), or 7+ (24 hours).

data.name: 52 Pickup
entries: {@note Made by Marvin}

You spray a 15-foot cone of spectral cards. Each creature in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Prone} condition until the spell ends. A Prone creature can take an action to make a Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the task of picking up cards an can get up from {@condition Prone}.
At the end of each of its turns and each time it takes damage, it makes another Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends on that creature.

data.name: Appraise
entries: {@note Made by Landon}

You touch an object. If the object is a magic item or some other magical object, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB}, and how many charges it has, if any. You learn whether any ongoing spells are affecting the item and what they are. If the item was created by a spell, you learn that spell's name.

If you instead touch a creature, it can make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, you reveal which ongoing spells or magical effects, if any, are currently affecting it, as well as one of the following characteristics of your choice:

items: What classes it has, if any

entries: This information appears as a screen in front of you in a language that you know, following you for the duration of the spell unless you dismiss it, ending the spell (no action required).
{@note Made by Landon}

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Slot.
entries: If you cast this spell using a level 3 spell slot or higher, you can learn an additional characteristic for each level above 2nd.

data.name: Consecrate

components.m: a vial of holy water and powdered silver worth at least 25gp, which the spell consumes.

entries: {@note Adapted from 3.5e, Made by Aris}

You choose a point within range and bless an area around it with positive energy. The area can have an Emanation up to 20 feet, and the spell fails if the Emanation includes an area already under the effect of a Consecrate spell or the {@spell Hallow|XPHB} spell. The affected area is subject to the following effects.
The ground within the area of this spell is considered consecrated ground. Undead standing on consecrated ground have Disadvantage on all saving throws.
In addition, undead cannot be raised or created within, or summoned into the area.

A {@item unholy water|WM4|vial of unholy water} defiles a 10-foot-square area of consecrated ground when sprinkled on it, and a {@spell Hallow|XPHB} (unholy) spell defiles consecrated ground within its area.

If the area contains an altar, shrine, or other permanent fixture of a deity, pantheon, or higher power other than your patron or deity, the consecrate spell instead curses the area, cutting off its connection with the associated deity or power. This secondary function, if used, does not grant the penalties to undead listed above.
If you cast consecrate on an area that includes desecrated ground from a {@spell Desecrate|WM4} spell, the {@spell Desecrate|WM4} spell is dispelled.

data.name: Desecrate

components.m: a vial of unholy water and powdered silver worth at least 25gp, which the spell consumes

entries: {@note Adapted from 3.5e, Made by Aris}

You choose a point within range and infuse an area around it with negative energy. The area can have an Emanation up to 20 feet, and the spell fails if the Emanation includes an area already under the effect of a Desecrate spell or the {@spell Hallow|XPHB} spell. The affected area is subject to the following effects.
The ground within the area of this spell is considered desecrated ground. Undead standing on desecrated ground have Advantage on all saving throws.
In addition, an undead creature raised or created within, or summoned into the area gains a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

A {@item Holy Water|XPHB|vial of holy water} purifies a 10-foot-square area of desecrated ground when sprinkled on it, and a {@spell Hallow|XPHB} (holy) spell purifies desecrated ground within its area.

If the area contains an altar, shrine, or other permanent fixture of a deity, pantheon, or higher power other than your patron or deity, the desecrate spell instead curses the area, cutting off its connection with the associated deity or power. This secondary function, if used, does not grant the benefits to undead listed above.
If you cast Desecrate on an area that includes consecrated ground from a {@spell Consecrate|WM4} spell, the {@spell Consecrate|WM4} spell is dispelled.

data.name: Entice Gift
entries: {@note Adapted from 3.5e, Made by Chrys}

By asking nicely, you can compel a non hostile creature to give you what it's holding. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it must spend its next turn moving as close to you as it can and hand (or toss if it's too far to hand) it to you.
Creatures immune to the {@condition Charmed} condition automatically succeed the saving throw.

data.name: Flash
entries: {@note Made by Gem.}

You conjure a node of incredibly bright light. Until the end of your next turn, you shed {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 30-foot radius, and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 30 feet. All creatures of your choice in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, they take {@dice 3d6} Radiant damage and are {@condition Blinded} until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The radius of the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}, {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB}, and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} increase by 15-feet for each spell slot level above 2.

data.name: Psychometry
entries: {@note Made by Aris}

You sense psychic impressions left by events in an area around you. The types of events most likely to leave psychic impressions are those that elicited strong emotions: battles, betrayals, marriages, murders, births, great pain, or any other event where one emotion dominates. Everyday occurrences leave little residue for you to detect.
The vision of the event is dreamlike and shadowy. Your vision is vague but you might be able to read large banners or other writing if they are in your language.

You can spend a minute studying, and make a DC 20 Intelligence ({@skill History} or {@skill Investigation}) or Wisdom ({@skill Insight} or {@skill Perception}) check (your choice). On a successful check, you can choose to learn one of the following pieces of information about the event:

items: The number of creatures to pass through the area.
The type of creatures to pass through the area.
The general alignment of the creatures that were in the area.
What direction the creatures came from to get to the area.
What the creatures did while they were in the area.
What direction the creatures went when they left the area.
The dominant emotion experienced by the creatures.

entries: You sense the most recent of such an event. After {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on an event for at least 10 minutes, you can shift to sensing the next most recent distinct event, if any such events exist to be sensed.
Creatures under the {@spell Mind Blank|XPHB} spell currently or while they were in the area in the past, are not detected by Psychometry.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can become more attuned to this sense. You can choose to sense either psychic impressions of powerful emotions, or psychic impressions of the most recent creatures to pass through the area.

data.name: Radiant Lattice
entries: {@note Made by Chrys}

You unleash a blinding mote at a creature you can see. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@dice 2d8} Radiant damage, is {@condition Blinded} until the end of its next turn, and {@condition Restrained} for the duration as the light unfurls into a golden net.
A {@condition Restrained} creature can use its action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against your spell save DC, ending the condition on a success.

data.name: Snow Cloud
entries: {@note Made by Gem}

You create a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} cloud of snow centered on a point within range. The Sphere is {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB}. It lasts for the duration or until a strong wind (such as one created by {@spell Gust of Wind|XPHB}) disperses it.
Each creature that starts its turn in the Sphere must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 2d4} Cold damage and have its Speed reduced by 15 feet until the start of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The fog's radius increases by 10 feet for each spell slot level above 2.

data.name: Summon Elysian Thrush
entries: {@note From 3.5e, Made by Aris}

You summon an Elysian Thrush within range. The Elysian Thrush is {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|friendly} to you and your allies. It obeys your commands, though it refuses to fight in combat, instead fleeing from perceived danger.

The Elysian Thrush uses the {@creature raven|XMM} statblock but is a Celestial, and their song is magically enchanting and beautiful. Any creature that finishes a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB} while within 30 feet of a singing Elysian Thrush rolls the maximum number on any hit dice it rolls to regain Hit Points.

data.name: Summon Plant

components.m: A pot of dirt worth 100+ gp

entries: {@note Made by Gem}

You call forth a {@creature Plant Spirit|WM4}. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range and uses the Plant Spirit stat block (see below). When you cast the spell, choose {@creature Plant spirit (Fungus)|WM4|Fungus (Small)}, {@creature Plant spirit (Tree)|WM4|Tree (Large)}, or {@creature Plant spirit (Vine)|WM4|Vine (Medium)}. The creature resembles a Plant of that kind, which determines certain details in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 Hit Points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, it shares your Initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and uses its movement to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Use the spell slot's level for the spell's level in the stat block.

data.name: Tunnel Vision
entries: {@note Made by Lily}
You attempt to constrain the senses of one creature within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it cannot benefit from any special senses for the duration of the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: If you cast this spell with a slot of 4th level or higher, the duration becomes {@status Concentration|XPHB}, up to 10 minutes. If you use a slot of 6th level or higher, the duration becomes {@status Concentration|XPHB}, up to 1 hour.

data.name: Vision of Entropy
entries: {@note Adapted from 3.5e. Made by Aris}

You form a vision of the seething, maddening chaos of the Abyss within a creature's mind. Choose a creature within range. At the start of each of the creature's turns, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature becomes {@condition Frightened} for the duration. If it fails a second time, it is no longer {@condition Frightened}, and becomes {@condition Confused|WM4} instead. If it fails its saving throw for a third time, it is no longer confused but gains a randomly determined short term madness for the duration.
Casting {@spell Lesser Restoration|XPHB}, {@spell Dispel Magic}, or any spell that removes madness from a target creature ends the effects of the spell.

Demons and creatures under the effects of the {@spell Calm Emotions|XPHB} or {@spell Protection from Evil and Good|XPHB} spells automatically succeed on all saving throws against the spell, as do creatures immune to {@condition Frightened}, {@condition Confused|WM4}, or madness.

data.name: Arcane Sight
entries: {@note From 3.5e, Made by Aris}

For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 120 feet of you, and you can see an aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic. You can determine the school of magic, if any. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action you can determine if a creature within range that you can see can cast spells, and if it can, you determine the level of the highest level spell it can cast.
The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

data.name: Awaken Sin
entries: {@note Adapted from Dragon Magazine 315. Made by Landon}

You show a creature the error of its ways. Choose a Humanoid, Fey, Giant, or Monstrosity within range. If it is Evil, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a Success, it is momentarily distracted by the weight of its sins and has a -1 penalty to D20 tests until the end of its next turn. On a Failure, it is instead {@condition Stunned} until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

data.name: Ethereal Shunt

components.m: an object from the Material Plane

entries: {@note Made by Gem.}
When you cast this spell, you momentarily gain the ability to see onto the Ethereal Plane allowing you to target creatures on it with this spell.

You force a creature in range to make a Charisma saving throw, or be forced out of the Ethereal Plane back to the plane they were previously on. The creature is unable to return to the Ethereal Plane until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The duration of the spell increases with a spell slot of level 5-6 (1 Minute), 7-8 (1 Hour), or 9+ (24 Hours)

data.name: Investiture of the Kyton
entries: {@note Based off of Investiture of the Chain Devil (3.5e), Made by Chrys}

With a rush of red light and the faint clanking of many chains, you invest the target creature with the power of a chain devil. The target creature gains Resistance to Fire damage and once on it's turns, can choose the following option when taking the {@action Attack|XPHB} action (The DC equal to your spell save DC):

entries.name: Conjure Infernal Chain.
entries: You target a creature within 60 feet of you as you summon a fiery chain to bind it. That creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@dice 2d4 + your Strength modifier} Fire damage and is {@condition Restrained} until the end of your next turn. If the target is Large or smaller, you move the target up to 30 feet straight toward yourself to an unoccupied space.

data.name: Magic Vestment
entries: {@note From 3.5e, Made by Chrys}
You touch a nonmagical armor or shield. Until the spell ends, that armor or shield becomes a magic armor or shield with a +1 bonus to AC. The spell ends early if you cast it again.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The bonus increases to +2 with a level 4-6 spell slot. The bonus increases to +3 with a level 7+ spell slot.

data.name: Pox
entries: {@note Adapted from 3.5e by Aris.}

You shout "A Pox on you!", and target a Humanoid, Giant, or Beast of your choice within range. The target creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become infected with a Magical Contagion. When you cast this spell, choose the contagion from one of the following options:

Alternatively, you can disease a body of water. You make exposed water inside an area you choose that is a Cube up to 100 feet on a side diseased. The water becomes diseased with {@condition Sight Rot|XDMG} or {@condition Throat Leeches|TOA} (your choice). The entire area of water can be purified with a single casting of {@spell Purify Food and Drink|XPHB} cast using a 5th level slot or higher.
At the DM's option, you may choose an alternative Magical Contagion effect, but it should be no more powerful than those described above. The DM has final say on such a contagion's effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd. The creatures must be within 10 feet of each other when you target them.

data.name: Putrid Aura
entries: {@note Made by Gem.}

You emit a putrid scent, filling a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you for the duration. Whenever a creature enters the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} or starts its turn there, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition Poisoned} until the end of its next turn. While {@condition Poisoned} in this way, it can't willingly move closer to you.
If a creature {@condition Poisoned} by this spell ends its turn in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}, it takes {@dice 6d6} Poison damage.
A creature makes this save only once per turn. When you cast this spell, you can designate creatures to be unaffected by it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The Emanation increases by 10-feet for each spell slot level above 3.

data.name: Spikeskin
entries: {@note Made by Gem.}
Until the spell ends, one willing creature touch grows sharp quills to ward off attackers. Whenever a creature hits the warded creature with a melee attack, it takes {@dice 2d8} Piecing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by 1d8 for every two levels above 3.

data.name: Wizard Blade

components.m: sharpening stone and a wooden handle

entries: {@note Made by Gem.}

You magically transform into a large sword of force. While in this form, you are unable to cast spells, have a {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} of 0, a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 30ft, and Immunity to the {@condition Prone} condition, but otherwise your stats remain unchanged. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action on your turn, you are able to make a spell attack with yourself against a creature within 5ft of you. On a hit the target takes Slashing or Force damage (chosen when you cast the spell) equal to {@dice 3d6} plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Additionally, another creature can carry and wield you as a martial melee weapon. The sword has a bonus to attack and damage rolls equal to half your spellcasting ability modifier (rounded down). On a hit, it deals {@dice 3d6} Slashing or Force damage (chosen when you cast the spell).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by 1d6 for every two levels above 3.

data.name: Missile Storm
entries: {@note Adapted from 3.5e. Made by Chrys}

You brandish a piece of nonmagical ammunition with duplicative magic. The first time you use this ammunition for an attack roll using a ranged weapon, you can instead make that attack roll against up to 12 creatures within a {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} a number of feet equal to the normal range of the weapon. You use the same attack roll for each target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When casted using a level 5 spell slot, the number of creatures you can target increases to 15.

data.name: Sensory Deprivation

components.m: black silk cloth tied like a blindfold

entries: {@note Adapted from 3.5e. Made by Chrys}

Rather than creating an illusion of something, this spell creates an illusion of absolute nothingness. A creature of your choice must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target only perceives a clinging darkness, and is {@condition Blinded} and {@condition Deafened} for the duration. The creature cannot benefit from {@sense Blindsight|XPHB}, {@sense Tremorsense|XPHB}, or scent.
An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by 1d6 for every two levels above 3.

data.name: Cyclonic Blast
entries: {@note Adapted from 3.5e. Made by Chrys}

You send a twisting torrent of wind, not unlike a tornado turned on its side, in a 120-foot-long, 5-foot-wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} must succeed on a Strength saving throw, taking {@dice 10d6} Thunder damage and falling {@condition Prone} on a failed save, or half damage only on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 5.

data.name: Forbidden Speech
entries: {@note From 3.5e. Adapted by Aris}

You make it impossible for a single creature to speak about a single topic. The topic should be as narrow as possible for the spell to work properly. An appropriate topic might be events that occurred while the creature was in captivity, the whereabouts and names of tormentors, the secret location of a hidden treasure, the password into a guarded compound, the command word of a magic item, or the explanation behind some major occurrence. Invalid topics include verbal components of spells, a creature's whole life history, or anything too broad for a reasonable definition of a single topic. Whether a topic is too broad is up the DM, who can cause the spell to fail and the slot to be wasted.

The affected creature cannot communicate regarding the topic in any way. Speech becomes gibberish, writing is reduced to an indecipherable scrawl, gestures are impossible, and even telepathy (including Detect Thoughts) is scrambled. The creature has not forgotten the information, however, and it can be a maddening occurrence for the creature to be unable to communicate information that might be of life-and-death importance to friends and allies.
A {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} or {@spell Greater Restoration|XPHB} spell cast on the target restores the creature's ability to speak about the topic.

data.name: Morality Undone
entries: {@note Made by Aris}

You target one creature within range and attempt to turn the target evil. The creature must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the target becomes evil. The chaotic/neutral/lawful component of the target's alignment is unchanged.

The target retains whatever outlook, allegiances, and outlooks it had before, so long as they do not conflict with the new alignment. An Evil creature automatically succeeds on its saving throw against this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: If you use a level 6+ spell slot, the duration becomes 8 hours (level 6-7 slot) or 24 hours (level 8 slot). If you use a level 9 spell slot, the spell lasts until dispelled.

data.name: Sympathetic Vibration
entries: {@note Made by Laz}

You strike a tuning fork and attune yourself to the natural resonance of a freestanding structure you are touching, such as a building, bridge, or dam. If the target is not freestanding, such as part of a larger mass of ground or embedded in surrounding rock, the spell fails and has no effect.
You can choose to end the spell early at any time.
The structure begins to vibrate violently. At the start of each of your turns, the target takes {@dice 2d10} Thunder damage. This damage ignores any damage threshold the structure may have.
This spell has no effect on creatures, including Constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a level 7+ spell slot, the duration increases by 1 minute for each slot above level 6.

data.name: Alter Creature

components.m: At least 5000 gp worth of reagents, which are consumed

entries: {@note Made by Landon}

You transform a target creature's appearance that is within range for the entire casting time of the spell. The target decides what they look like, including height, weight, facial features, sound of voice, hair length, coloration, and distinguishing characteristics, if any. They can make themselves appear as a member of another species, though none of their statistics change. They also don't appear as a creature of a different size category, and their shape stays the same.

data.name: Befoul

components.m: a dead fish and a drop of poison

entries: {@note From 3.5e and the Wastrilith 5e statblock. Made by Aris}

You make exposed water inside an area you choose that is a Cube up to 800 feet on a side foul and poisonous. Underwater, this effect lightly obscures the area until a strong current clears it away. Water in containers remains corrupted until it evaporates.

A creature that consumes this foul water or swims in it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the foul water for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature takes 4d6 Poison damage and is Poisoned for 1 minute. At the end of this time, the Poisoned creature must repeat the saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes {@dice 4d8} Poison damage and is {@condition Poisoned} until it finishes a Long Rest.

If you only affect part of a large body of water, the befouled water mixes with the pure water. If the entire body of water is no more than four times the size of the affected area, all the water in the body of water is befouled 24 hours later, but the damage from drinking or swimming in the water is only half the damage dice. If the body of water is more than four times the affected area but less than twenty times the affected area, after 24 hours all of the water tastes foul, but is not poisonous. If the entire body is larger than twenty times the affected area, the fouled water mixes with the clean water and loses all effect after 24 hours.
A strong magical current, such as a {@spell Control Water|XPHB} spell, can purify areas the spell affects of the befoulment.

data.name: Evolve

components.m: Organic material from a Humanoid, a miniature tool, and a pearl worth 500+ gp, which the spell consumes

entries: {@note From 2e. Made by Gem}

You touch a Beast and cause it to begin to transform into a Humanoid lifeform. This spell has no effect on a creature transformed into a Beast (such as through {@spell Shapechange|XPHB} or {@spell Polymorph|XPHB}) or a Beast without a CR. A Beast with an Intelligence of 4 or higher can choose to be unaffected by this spell. The Beast is {@condition Unconscious} for the duration of the spell.

If the spell lasts for its entire duration, then the creature is permanently changed, requiring {@spell Wish} in order to undo. The target’s creature type becomes Humanoid (Evolved Beast) and its form changes to a Humanoid one retaining its original characteristics (Ex: wings, tails, hooves). No matter the original form, the new one has at least 2 arms and 2 legs. If the creature is Tiny, its size becomes Small. If the creature is Large or larger, its size becomes Medium.

Additionally all of the target’s ability scores increase to 10, unless they are already higher than that. The target gains the ability to speak all languages you know. It gains proficiency in Simple and Martial weapons, and training in Light, Medium, and Heavy armor and Shields.
The evolved target has the {@condition Charmed} condition for 30 days or until you or your allies deal damage to it. When that condition ends, the evolved creature chooses its attitude toward you.

data.name: Crushing Foot of Spite

components.m: A severed foot from a good-aligned humanoid cleric.

entries: {@note Adapted from the Book of Vile Darkness by Lily, Turned to Feet by Gem}

A foot composed of clouds or shadows appears 30 feet above the ground and begins smashing down with incredible power. All creatures and objects within a 5-foot radius {@variantrule Cylinder [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cylinder}, 30 feet high below the foot must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes {@dice 20d6} Bludgeoning damage, or half on a successful save. On subsequent turns as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can move the foot anywhere else in range and immediately smash down. If you do not take this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, it smashes down in the same place at the end of your turn.
Airborne creatures in the area are knocked {@condition Prone} on a failed save and are pushed downward to the ground.

data.name: Legal Name Change
entries: {@note Made by Lily}

You endeavor to officially change the name of a willing creature you touch for the entire casting time, finishing by speaking their new name. This affects the creature's name, but not their magical true name, nor any titles and epithets. Any written mention of the original name is overwritten with the new one, and any memory of their old name is erased. Anyone who knew their old name now knows their new one, which functions as their real name for purposes such as the {@spell gate|XPHB} spell.

components.m: A stack of paperwork as tall as the target

data.name: Unname
entries: {@i Development: 168 hours, 65,000 GP}
{@note From 3.5e. Made by Chrys}
With this most powerful of spells, you erase a subject’s truename from existence itself.

You target a creature with more than 3 Intelligence that you know the truename of and must succeed on an {@skill Arcana} check using your spellcasting ability score, the DC equal to 10 + the CR or level of the target creature (whichever is higher), to correctly speak the truename. On a success, the target creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be obliterated from existence. Likewise, all items being worn or carried by the target creature are erased with it.
